Step 1: Understand what CURB-65 means.
The CURB-65 score is used to assess the severity of community-acquired pneumonia (CAP). CURB-65 stands for:
- Confusion (new onset)
- Raised Urea level (>7 mmol/L)
- Respiratory rate of 30 breaths per minute or more
- Systolic BP ≤ 90 mmHg or Diastolic BP ≤ 60 mmHg
- Age 65 years or older.
